entities.monsters

Class Monster

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.Entity
      • entities.monsters.Monster
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Goblin, Orc

    public abstract class Monster
extends Entity
    A monster is a type of Entity that is not controlled by the player. Any NPCs that are not technically monsters will still need to be made using this abstract class.

    This class contains the definitions for the .attack(), .act(), and .die() methods, as well as the method statement .attackString(). The only variable housed in this class is the XPval integer, as it is only necessary for Monsters.

    Author:
    Dr. Cheese

      • Fields inherited from class entities.Entity

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> actors)
      For Monsters, the act method simply finds the instance of Char in the encounter ArrayList and attacks it.
      void attack(Entity target)
      This method makes the entity attack another Entity, which is the default option for monsters/NPCs.
      abstract java.lang.String attackString(int dmg, Entity target)
      The .attackString() method constructs a String that lets the player know what happened in a stylized manner that is meant to vary by monster.
      void die(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> actors)
      This method removes the entity from combat in a way that differs depending on if it is a character or monster/NPC.
      boolean equals(Entity other)
      This method checks for equivalency by first checking if the other Entity is a Monster, and then checking each stat.
      void setXPval(int newVal)
      Changes the value of XP for the monster to a new value.
      int XPval()
      Finds and returns the value containing how much XP is gained when the Monster dies in combat.

        Description copied from class: Entity
        This method makes the entity attack another Entity, which is the default option for monsters/NPCs.
        Specified by:
        attack in class Entity
        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • act

        public final void act(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> actors)
        For Monsters, the act method simply finds the instance of Char in the encounter ArrayList and attacks it.
        Specified by:
        act in class Entity
        Parameters:
        actors - the encounter the Entity is currently in.
        See Also:
        attack(Entity)

      • die

        public final void die(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> actors)
        Description copied from class: Entity
        This method removes the entity from combat in a way that differs depending on if it is a character or monster/NPC. If a monster dies, they are removed from combat with a simple statement and the monster's XP value is added to the party. If a character dies, (currently) the game will close.
        Specified by:
        die in class Entity
        Parameters:
        actors - The encounter ArrayList
        See Also:
        Entity.checkForDeath()

      • XPval

        public final int XPval()
        Finds and returns the value containing how much XP is gained when the Monster dies in combat.
        Returns:
        The value of XP for the Monster.

      • setXPval

        public final void setXPval(int newVal)
        Changes the value of XP for the monster to a new value.
        Parameters:
        newVal - the new value for the XPval to be set to.

      • attackString

        public abstract java.lang.String attackString(int dmg,
                                              Entity target)
        The .attackString() method constructs a String that lets the player know what happened in a stylized manner that is meant to vary by monster.
        Parameters:
        dmg - How much damage the monster is doing with the attack.
        target - The target Entity of the attack.
        Returns:
        A string containing the results of the attack.
        See Also:
        attack(Entity)

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(Entity other)
        This method checks for equivalency by first checking if the other Entity is a Monster, and then checking each stat.
        Parameters:
        other - The other Entity to check.
        Returns:
        True if everything is equal, and false if otherwise.
